parameter.name: ModelDeterminism
parameter.definition: The most important aspect determining the value of this property is whether it produces stochastic or deterministic output. That is, does the approach produce the same outputs given the same inputs. If the method consists of multiple components each of which might be deterministic or stochastic, please describe the characteristic of the final output. If the method can truly be run deterministically and stochastically, then a separate metadata document should be created for each type.

parameter.name: MethodType
parameter.definition: The MethodType describes the types of methods that can be building blocks of a downscaling approach. The methods listed here are used to tag the specific approach that is being described.

value.name: yes, method preserves spatial correlations among sites
yes, method developed independently for each site
no, method developed for a single site
yes, method preserves correlations among predictands
yes, method developed independently for each predictand
no, method is developed for one predictand

parameter.name: Predictor-PredictandCorrespondence
parameter.definition: Where homogeneous implies same surface predictors and surface predictands (as in Rummukainen 1997), and heterogeneous implies upper-air predictors to surface predictands. If this method includes both homogeneous and heterogeneous relationships, please provide more details in the description field of this property.

value.name: homogeneous, same surface predictors and surface predictands
heterogeneous, including upper-air predictors to surface predictands

parameter.name: ExplicitBiasCorrectionStep
parameter.definition: Is an explicit bias correction step included in this method? If so, please describe the type of bias correction used
